original: Source: PARETEUM CORP, 8-K, 10/1/2008 CONFIDENTIAL  TREATMENT REQUESTED WITH RESPECT TO CERTAIN PORTIONS HEREOF DENOTED  WITH “***” Hosting Agreement between ELEPHANT TALK and T-Mobile, 18/9/2008 Source: PARETEUM CORP, 8-K, 10/1/2008 1.33"TAP" shall mean Transferred Account Procedure as defined and described  in GSM Association Permanent Reference Documents.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Altered: In the hosting agreement between ELEPHANT TALK and T-Mobile, dated 18/9/2008 (as referenced in PARETEUM CORP's 8-K filing of 10/1/2008), any reference to "TAP" shall be understood as Transferred Account Procedure, a term defined and explained within the GSM Association's Permanent Reference Documents. However, for the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby clarified that T-Mobile has no obligation to adhere to or implement this procedure unless expressly agreed upon in writing.

In this revised version, the responsibility for implementing the Transferred Account Procedure (TAP) has been shifted from being an obligation on both parties to being optional for T-Mobile unless expressly agreed upon in writing.

original: 1.35"T-Mobile  Network" shall mean the T-Mobile DCS 1800  and UMTS/HSDPA  mobile telecommunications network, including all network elements, in the  Netherlands, as described in Appendix  1.
ollama_generated:
1.35 "T-Mobile Network" shall encompass the T-Mobile DCS 1800 and UMTS/HSDPA mobile telecommunications network, comprising all network elements, within the Netherlands, as outlined in Appendix 1, subject to any modifications or upgrades that may occur during the term of this agreement, for which T-Mobile shall retain responsibility.

Changes made:
1. The clause now includes the possibility of network modifications or upgrades. This means that the network covered by the agreement may change slightly over time.
2. Responsibility for any modifications or upgrades has been shifted to T-Mobile. This means that if there are any changes to the network, T-Mobile is responsible for managing these changes.

8. THE CO-OPERATION RELATIONSHIP 8.1The authorized members of each Party shall fully co-operate in the performance  of the Agreement. The account manager of each Party shall act as  the first point of contact in relation to any issues provided for in the Agreement.  Each Party may change its contact person at any time by informing  the other Party  in writing.
ollama_generated:
8. CO-OPERATION AND CONTACTS

8.1 Each Party acknowledges that their level of co-operation in executing this Agreement is discretionary, although they are encouraged to act diligently and promptly in their interactions. The designated representatives of each Party shall serve as primary contacts for addressing matters pertaining to this Agreement. Any changes to the designated representative must be communicated in writing to the other Party by the new contact person.

8.2 In the event that one Party deems it necessary, they may appoint a substitute to act on their behalf within the co-operation relationship established under this Agreement. Such substitutions shall be effective upon notification to the other Party. The receiving Party is not obligated to acknowledge or respond to any communications from the substituted representative until proper verification of authority has been provided by the appointing Party.

9.4 Financial Security Modification

9.4.1. In the event that **T-Mobile** has filed for bankruptcy or is declared bankrupt under section 18.1 sub g, or;
9.4.2. T-Mobile shall not demand financial security as outlined in 9.4.1, provided that **ELEPHANT TALK's customers using ELEPHANT TALK services** continue to do so. In the case where **T-Mobile** finds itself in a situation of bankruptcy, it is **ELEPHANT TALK** who shall issue an invoice to T-Mobile. The parties agree that as long as the conditions specified above persist:

In this revised clause, the responsibility for issuing an invoice is shifted from T-Mobile to Elephant Talk when T-Mobile is in a state of bankruptcy. Additionally, the condition for not requiring financial security has been changed to be based on Elephant Talk's customers continuing to use their services rather than T-Mobile's customers using T-Mobile services.

12. LIMITATION OF RESPONSIBILITY
12.1 Except as otherwise explicitly provided in this Agreement, neither Party shall be held responsible for any harm incurred by the other Party, arising from actions or omissions attributable to them or individuals for whom they are legally liable, beyond the following circumstances and the corresponding limits:

original: 13.2Furthermore,  T-Mobile may without liability temporarily suspend all or any of its  Hosting Services to ELEPHANT TALK if a (partial or temporary) breakdown  on the T-Mobile Network should occur. ollama_generated:
13.2 In certain circumstances, ELEPHANT TALK acknowledges and agrees that T-Mobile holds no liability for temporarily discontinuing all or part of its Hosting Services, should an (intermittent or localized) failure occur within the T-Mobile Network. Any such interruption shall be restricted to the specific Location Areas affected by the network malfunction. Upon restoration of the T-Mobile Network, T-Mobile will endeavor, where feasible, to promptly restore the Hosting Services. The timeframe for resumption of service will adhere to the guidelines outlined in Appendix 6.

In this revised clause, the focus has been shifted from T-Mobile's responsibility to suspend services when needed, to ELEPHANT TALK acknowledging and agreeing that such action can be taken by T-Mobile without liability. Additionally, the language has been adjusted to emphasize that T-Mobile will make reasonable efforts to resume services as soon as possible rather than stating they shall take all appropriate measures to do so with the shortest possible delay.

original: 20. MISCELLANEOUS 20.1 Successors,  Assigns This Agreement and the rights and obligations specified herein shall be binding  upon the Parties and their respective legal successors and neither Party shall sell,  transfer or assign this Agreement or any part, interest, right or obligation  hereunder except that a Party shall have the right to transfer or assign this  Agreement in whole (but not in part) to an Affiliated Company provided  that:
ollama_generated:
20. MISCELLANEOUS

20.1 Successors, Assigns
This Agreement and the rights and obligations outlined herein shall bind any successors or assigns of the Parties, with the exception that either Party may transfer or assign this Agreement in its entirety (but not partially) to any Affiliated Entity without restriction; however, such transfer or assignment shall not release the original Party from any existing liabilities or obligations under this Agreement.

This modification aims to clarify that while a party can transfer or assign the Agreement in its entirety, they remain responsible for fulfilling their pre-existing duties and obligations under this Agreement.

original: 20.6 Survival Any provision of this Agreement which by its nature or implication (including in  respect of any accrued rights and liabilities) is required to survive termination or expiry of this Agreement shall survive termination or expiry  as aforesaid.
ollama_generated: 20.6 Persistence: Upon the termination or expiration of this Agreement, any provision that by its inherent nature or implication (including those pertaining to vested rights and outstanding obligations) shall endure post-termination or expiration will remain in effect, unless expressly provided otherwise. This includes provisions related to liabilities accrued prior to termination.
